00105 static cache_inode_gc_policy_t cache_inode_gc_policy ; /*<< the policy to be used by the garbagge collector */
00106 
00127 static int cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00128 {
00129   fsal_handle_t              * pfsal_handle     = NULL ;
00130   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter      = NULL ;
00131   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter_next = NULL ;
00132   cache_inode_fsal_data_t      fsaldata ;
00133   cache_inode_status_t         status ;
00134   fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00135   hash_buffer_t                key, old_key, old_value ;
00136   int                          rc ;
00137   hash_data_t                * pdata = NULL ;
00138   cache_inode_fsal_data_t    * ppoolfsdata = NULL ;
00139 
00140 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00141   printf( "(pthread_self=%d): About to remove pentry=%p\n", pentry ) ;  
00142 #endif
00143 
00144   /* Get the FSAL handle */
00145   if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, &status ) ) == NULL )
00146     {
00147       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00148                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: unable to retrieve pentry's specific filesystem info" ) ;
00149       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00150     }
00151   
00152   fsaldata.handle = *pfsal_handle ;
00153 
00154   if( pentry->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00155     fsaldata.cookie = DIR_START ;
00156   else
00157     fsaldata.cookie = pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos ;
00158   
00159   /* Use the handle to build the key */
00160   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, &fsaldata, pgcparam->pclient ) )
00161     {
00162       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00163                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: could not build hashtable key" ) ;
00164 
00165       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00166       
00167       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00168     }
00169   
00170   
00171   /* use the key to delete the entry */
00172   if( ( rc = HashTable_Del( pgcparam->ht, &key, &old_key, &old_value ) ) != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS )
00173     {
00174       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00175                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: entry could not be deleted, status = %d", rc ) ;
00176 
00177       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00178 
00179       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00180     }
00181 
00182   /* Clean up the associated ressources in the FSAL */
00183   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR(  fsal_status = FSAL_CleanObjectResources( pfsal_handle ) ) )
00184     {
00185        DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00186                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: Could'nt free FSAL ressources fsal_status.major=%u", fsal_status.major ) ;
00187     }
00188      
00189 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC  
00190   printf( "++++> pentry %p deleted from HashTable\n", pentry ) ;
00191 #endif
00192 
00193   /* Release the hash key data */ 
00194   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &old_key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00195   
00196   /* Sanity check: old_value.pdata is expected to be equal to pentry,
00197    * and is released later in this function */
00198   if ( (cache_entry_t*)old_value.pdata != pentry )
00199   {
00200        DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00201                          "cache_inode_gc_clean_entry: unexpected pdata %p from hash table (pentry=%p)",
00202                           old_value.pdata, pentry ) ;
00203   }
00204   
00205   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pgcparam->pclient);     
00206 
00207   /* Recover the parent list entries */
00208   parent_iter = pentry->parent_list  ;
00209   while( parent_iter != NULL ) 
00210     {
00211       parent_iter_next = parent_iter->next_parent ;
00212 
00213       RELEASE_PREALLOC( parent_iter, pgcparam->pclient->pool_parent, next_alloc ) ;
00214    
00215       parent_iter = parent_iter_next ;
00216     }
00217   
00218 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00219   printf( "++++> parent directory sent back to pool\n" ) ;
00220 #endif
00221 
00222   /* If entry is a DIR_CONTINUE or a DIR_BEGINNING, release pdir_data */
00223   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00224     {
00225       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00226       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data, pgcparam->pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00227     }
00228 
00229   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00230     {
00231       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00232       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data, pgcparam->pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
00233     }
00234   
00235 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00236   printf( "++++> pdir_data (if needed) sent back to pool\n" ) ;
00237 #endif
00238 
00239   /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
00240   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pgcparam->pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00241 
00242   /* Destroy the mutex associated with the pentry */
00243   cache_inode_mutex_destroy( pentry ) ;
00244   
00245   /* Regular exit */
00246   pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged =  pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged -1 ;
00247 
00248 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00249   printf( "++++> pentry %p: clean entry is ok\n", pentry )  ;
00250 #endif  
00251 
00252   return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ; /* Cleaning ok */
00253 }
00254 
00267 static int cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent(  cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00268 {
00269   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter    = NULL ;
00270   
00271 
00272   /* Set the cache status as INVALID in the directory entries */
00273   for( parent_iter = pentry->parent_list ; parent_iter != NULL ; parent_iter = parent_iter->next_parent )
00274     {
00275       if( parent_iter->parent == NULL )
00276         {
00277            DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG,
00278                               "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: pentry %p has no parent, no dirent to be removed...", pentry ) ;
00279             continue ;
00280         } 
00281       
00282       /* If I reached this point, then parent_iter->parent is not null and is a valid cache_inode pentry */
00283       P( parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00284       
00285       /* Check for type of the parent */
00286       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && 
00287           parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00288         {
00289           V( parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00290           /* Major parent incoherency: parent is no directory */
00291           DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00292                              "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: major incoherency. Found an entry whose parent is no directory" ) ;
00293           return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00294         }
00295       
00296       /* Set the entry as invalid in the dirent array */
00297       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00298         {
00299           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00300             {
00301                 V( parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00302                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed, entry not removed %d", 
00303                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
00304                 return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00305             }
00306           else
00307            {
00308               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
00309               /* Garbagge invalidates the effet of the readdir previously made */
00310               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_NO ;
00311               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.nbactive -= 1 ;
00312            }
00313         }
00314       else
00315         {
00316           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
00317             {
00318                 V( parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00319                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed %d, entry not removed",
00320                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
00321                 return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00322             }
00323           else
00324             {
00325                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
00326                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.nbactive -= 1 ;
00327             }
00328         }
00329       
00330 
00331       V( parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
00332     }
00333 
00334   
00335   return  LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00336 } /* cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent */
00337 
00352 int cache_inode_gc_suppress_file( cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00353 {
00354   P( pentry->lock ) ;
00355 
00356   DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00357                      "Entry %p (REGULAR_FILE/SYMBOLIC_LINK) will be garbagged" ) ;
00358 
00359   /* Set the entry as invalid */
00360   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = INVALID ;
00361 
00362 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00363   printf( "****> cache_inode_gc_suppress_file on %p\n", pentry ) ;
00364 #endif
00365 
00366   /* Remove refences in the parent entries */
00367   if( cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00368    { 
00369       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00370       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00371    }
00372 
00373   /* Unlonk the entry before destroying it */
00374   V( pentry->lock ) ;
00375 
00376   /* Clean the entry */
00377   if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00378     return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00379 
00380   return  LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00381 } /* cache_inode_gc_suppress_file */
00382 
00397 int cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory( cache_entry_t * pentry,  cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam )
00398 {
00399   cache_entry_t * pentry_iter      = NULL ;
00400   cache_entry_t * pentry_iter_save = NULL ;
00401   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00402   
00403   P( pentry->lock ) ;
00404   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = INVALID ;
00405   
00406   if( cache_inode_is_dir_empty( pentry ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00407     {
00408       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00409 
00410       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00411                          "Entry %p (DIR_CONTINUE) is not empty. The dir_chain will not be garbagged now", pentry_iter ) ;
00412       
00413       return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ; /* entry is not to be suppressed */
00414     }
00415 
00416   /* If we reached this point, the directory contains no active entry, it should be removed from the cache */
00417   DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00418                      "Entry %p (DIR_BEGINNING) and its associated dir_chain will be garbagged", pentry ) ;
00419   
00420 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE_GC
00421   printf( "****> cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory on %p\n", pentry ) ;
00422 #endif
00423 
00424   /* Remove refences in the parent entries */
00425   if( cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00426     {
00427       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00428       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00429     }
00430 
00431 
00432 #ifdef _GHGHGHGHGHGHGH  
00433   /* Remove the next entries in the pdir_chain */
00434   pentry_iter = pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ; 
00435   while( pentry_iter != NULL ) 
00436     {
00437       pentry_iter_save = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00438 
00439       if( cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry_iter, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00440         {
00441           V( pentry->lock ) ;
00442           return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00443         }
00444       
00445       pentry_iter = pentry_iter_save ;
00446     }   
00447 #endif
00448 
00449   /* Remove the whole dir_chain from the cache */
00450   pentry_iter = pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ; 
00451   while( pentry_iter != NULL ) 
00452     {
00453       pentry_iter_save = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
00454       
00455       if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry_iter, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00456         {
00457           V( pentry->lock ) ;
00458           return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00459         }
00460       
00461       pentry_iter = pentry_iter_save ;
00462     }   
00463 
00464   if( cache_inode_gc_clean_entry( pentry, pgcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID )
00465     {
00466       V( pentry->lock ) ;
00467       return  LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00468     }
00469   
00470   /* Finally, release the lock */
00471   V( pentry->lock ) ; 
00472   return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00473 } /* cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory */
00474 
00490 int cache_inode_gc_function( LRU_entry_t * plru_entry, void * addparam )
00491 {
00492   time_t                   entry_time   = 0  ;
00493   time_t                   current_time = time( NULL ) ;
00494   cache_entry_t          * pentry       = NULL ;
00495   cache_inode_param_gc_t * pgcparam     = (cache_inode_param_gc_t *)addparam ;
00496   
00497   /* Get the entry */
00498   pentry = (cache_entry_t *)(plru_entry->buffdata.pdata) ;
00499 
00500   /* Get the entry time (the larger value in read_time and mod_time ) */
00501   if( pentry->internal_md.read_time > pentry->internal_md.mod_time )
00502     entry_time = pentry->internal_md.read_time ;
00503   else
00504     entry_time = pentry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00505 
00506    
00507   if( pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged != 0 )
00508     {
00509       DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00510                          "We still need %d entries to be garbagged", pgcparam->nb_to_be_purged  ) ;
00511       
00512       /* Should we get ride of this entry ? */
00513       if( ( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING ) &&
00514           ( cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay > 0 )  )
00515         {
00516           if( current_time - entry_time > cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay )
00517             {
00518               /* Entry should be tagged invalid */
00519               DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00520                                  "----->>>>>>>> DIR GC : Garbagge collection on dir entry %p", pentry ) ;
00521               return cache_inode_gc_suppress_directory( pentry, pgcparam ) ;
00522             }
00523           else
00524             DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "No garbagge on dir entry %p %d %d", 
00525                                pentry,  current_time - entry_time, cache_inode_gc_policy.directory_expiration_delay ) ;
00526         }
00527       else if( ( pentry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ||  pentry->internal_md.type == SYMBOLIC_LINK ) &&
00528                ( cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay > 0 ) )
00529         {
00530           if( current_time - entry_time > cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay )
00531             {
00532               /* Entry should be suppress and tagged invalid */
00533               DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00534                                  "----->>>>>> REGULAR/SYMLINK GC : Garbagge collection on regular/symlink entry %p", 
00535                                  pentry ) ;
00536               return cache_inode_gc_suppress_file( pentry, pgcparam ) ;
00537             }
00538           else
00539             DisplayLogJdLevel( pgcparam->pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "No garbagge on regular/symlink entry %p %d %d", 
00540                                pentry, current_time - entry_time, cache_inode_gc_policy.file_expiration_delay ) ;
00541         }
00542     }
00543   
00544   /* Default return, entry is not to be set invalid */
00545   return 0 ;
00546 } /* cache_inode_gc_function */
00547 
00548 /* @} */
00549 
00567 void cache_inode_set_gc_policy( cache_inode_gc_policy_t policy )
00568 {
00569   cache_inode_gc_policy = policy ;
00570 } /* cache_inode_set_gc_policy */
00571 
00572 
00580 cache_inode_gc_policy_t cache_inode_get_gc_policy( void )
00581 {
00582   return cache_inode_gc_policy ;
00583 } /* cache_inode_get_gc_policy */
00584 
00603 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_gc( hash_table_t             * ht,
00604                                      cache_inode_client_t     * pclient,
00605                                      cache_inode_status_t     * pstatus)
00606 {
00607   cache_inode_param_gc_t gcparam ;
00608   unsigned int           hash_size ;
00609   unsigned int           invalid_before_gc = 0 ;
00610   unsigned int           invalid_after_gc  = 0 ;
00611  
00612   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00613   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00614 
00615   /* Is this time to gc ? */
00616   if( pclient->call_since_last_gc <  cache_inode_gc_policy.nb_call_before_gc )
00617     return *pstatus ;
00618   
00619   if( time( NULL ) - pclient->time_of_last_gc < (int)(cache_inode_gc_policy.run_interval) )
00620     return *pstatus ;
00621   
00622   /* Actual GC will be made */
00623   pclient->call_since_last_gc = 0 ;
00624   pclient->time_of_last_gc = time( NULL ) ;
00625 
00626   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "It's time to see if garbagge collection is needed !!" ) ;
00627                      
00628   /* 1st ; we get the hash table size to see if garbagge is required */
00629   hash_size = HashTable_GetSize( ht ) ;
00630 
00631 
00632   if( hash_size > cache_inode_gc_policy.hwmark_nb_entries )
00633     {
00634       /*
00635        * Garbagge collection is made in several steps
00636        *    1- Set the oldest entry as invalid and garbagge their contents
00637        *    2- Free the invalid entry in the LRU
00638        *         
00639        *    Behaviour: - A DIR_BEGINNING is garbagged with all its DIR_CONTINUE associated
00640        *               - A directory is garbagged when all its entries are garbagged
00641        *
00642        */
00643       
00644       gcparam.ht              = ht ;
00645       gcparam.pclient         = pclient ;
00646       gcparam.nb_to_be_purged = hash_size - cache_inode_gc_policy.lwmark_nb_entries ; /* try to purge until lw mark is reached */
00647       
00648       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Garbagge collection started" ) ;
00649      
00650       invalid_before_gc = pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid ; 
00651       if( LRU_invalidate_by_function( pclient->lru_gc, cache_inode_gc_function, (void *)&gcparam ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00652         {
00653           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00654           return *pstatus ;
00655         }
00656       
00657       invalid_after_gc = pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid ; 
00658 
00659       /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
00660       if( LRU_gc_invalid( pclient->lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00661         {
00662           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00663           return *pstatus ;
00664         }
00665 
00666       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Garbagge collection finished, %u entries removed", invalid_after_gc - invalid_before_gc ) ;
00667 
00668       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00669     }
00670   else
00671     {
00672       /* no garbagge is required, just gets ride of the invalid in tyhe LRU list */
00673       /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
00674       if( LRU_gc_invalid( pclient->lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00675         {
00676           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00677           return *pstatus ;
00678         }
00679       else
00680         *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00681     }
00682 
00683   return *pstatus ;
00684 } /* cache_inode_gc */
00685 
00686 /* @} */
Generated on Wed Apr 9 08:24:52 2008 for Cache inode layer by  1.3.9.1
